title: A close match for unavailable typeface - Quadra by Rudolph de Harak
content:
Hi all,  
I’m looking for alternatives to a typeface that is not available in electronic form, as far as I can tell from my searches.  
The face is called ’Quadra’, designed in 1970 by Rudolph de Harak. Can anyone suggest something that closely resembles this?  
Cheers.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070803081121im_/http:/typophile.com/files/quadra-font.gif)

 [‹ Toy’s brands typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20070803081121/http:/typophile.com/node/19281 "Go to previous forum topic") [Recommendation for IMPACT alternative ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070803081121/http:/typophile.com/node/19275 "Go to next forum topic")
author: robbo

comments.content: i dunno, but you could recreate this in 20 minutes in Illustrator.

Paul’s right. But if you don’t want to worry about the spacing and font production part, you could try [P22 De Stijl.](http://web.archive.org/web/20070803081121/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=PY.114299.0.0), tho it’s much more symmetrical.
